snippet: To raise a child who enjoys good food, you have to cook good food yourself.
abstract: To raise a child who enjoys good food, you have to cook good food yourself.
lead_paragraph: Chicken fingers. No one - no chef and no parent - wants to raise a child who eats only chicken fingers. Or only white bread, or pasta-with-butter-and-nothing-else. The question of how to raise that highly desirable child who eats everything is one many first-time parents grapple with, and Fanae Aaron, an author and art director, was one such parent. Unlike most of us, though, who approach the process through trial and error, asking around the playground and either embracing or completely rejecting the foods we grew up with, Ms. Aaron set out to ask chefs how they fed their kids (who, she rightly presumed, mostly ate more than just white food).

headline.main: Teaching Children to Love Healthy Food
